data: OB Oxytocin Induction or Augmentation of Labour with Oxytocin (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Refer to Society of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists of Canada (SOGC) Clinical Practice Guideline Induction of Labour
Refer to Safe Handling of Oxytocin (found on OurNH → Medications → Process)
Refer to 1-1-2-190 Induction and Augmentation of Labour: Oxytocin
Patient Care
Complete Pre-Oxytocin Checklist
Monitoring During Oxytocin Infusion
Fetal Monitoring
Continuous electronic fetal monitoring (EFM)

EFM may be interrupted for periods of up to 30 minutes in the first stage of labour (if tracing is normal, maternal-fetal condition is stable, and the infusion rate of oxytocin has not been increased in the last 30 minutes) to allow form ambulation, personal care and hydrotherapy
Assess and document the fetal heart rate (FHR) and uterine assessment (UA):
q15 minutes during first stage of labour and before the onset of pushing in the second stage
q15 minutes during active second stage, once the pushing has begun
maternal heart rate, respirations, and blood pressure q30min and prn. Notify MRP if vitals outside normal limits
maternal temperature q4h if membranes intact, q2h once membranes have ruptured and prn. Notify MRP if temperature is greater than 38 degrees
monitor intake and output q4h and observe for signs of water intoxication/hyponatremia (lethargy, ataxia, confusion, seizures)
vaginal examination q2-4h or prn for labour progress in the first stage
vaginal examination q1h in the active second stage
Continuous Infusions
Primary IV initiated with mainenance infusion at 125ml/hr on IV smart pump (if indicated)
Sodium Chloride 0.9% (NS)
125 ml/hr on IV smart pump
Ringers Lactate
125 ml/hr on IV smart pump
Diabetic protocol - Refer to 10-111-5252 Labour and Birth Gestational Diabetes Intrapartum Management
D5W
125 ml/hr on IV smart pump
Piggyback oxytocin infusion onto primgary IV line connected at port closest to the patient

If uterine tachysystole (more than 5 contractions in 10 minutes averaged over 30 minutes) and / OR atypical or abnormal FHR in the presence of suspected maternal and/or fetal hypovolemia or rapid decrease in maternal blood pressure (e.g. after epidrual top up):
sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) bolus 500 ml once PRN, administer over 10 minutes
sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) bolus 250 ml once PRN, administer over 10 minutes
Do not order fluid bolus if contraindicated by maternal condution (e.g. significant underlying cardiovascular conditions).
Medications
oxytocin 30 units IV in NS 500 ml (0.06 units/mL) in NS
OR
oxytocin 30 units IV in D5NS 500 ml (0.06 units/mL) in NS - for diabetic patients
Low dose oxytocin
Use low dose oxytocin if:  - All augmentations in 2nd stage  - Parous augmentation  - Grand multiparous induction and augmentation  - Vaginal birth after cesarean augmentation and induction
titrate 1 milliunit/min (3 mL/hour) starting rate to 20 milliunit/min maximum rate. Titrate by 1 to 2 milliunits/min at 30 minute intervals until regular uterine activity is established
titrate 2 milliunit/min (6 mL/hour) starting rate to 20 milliunit/min maximum rate. Titrate by 1 to 2 milliunits/min at 30 minute intervals until regular uterine activity is established
High dose oxytocin (if indicated and in consultation with OBGYN - resources permitting)
Use high dose oxytocin if:  - Parous induction - Nulliparous augmentation - nullipraous induction in the 1st stage
titrate 2 milliunit/min (6 mL/hour) starting rate to 20 milliunit/min maximum rate. Titrate by 2 to 4 milliunits/min at 30 minute intervals until regular uterine activity is established
titrate 4 milliunit/min (12 mL/hour) starting rate to 20 milliunit/min maximum rate. Titrate by 2 to 4 milliunits/min at 30 minute intervals until regular uterine activity is established
Reassess Oxytocin
Provider to reassess when oxytocin 20 milliunits/min is reached
Oxytocin may not be started unless the oxytocin checklist is complete
if uterine activity has not returned to normal after 10 minutes, discontinue oxytocin until tachysystole resolves
Reduce Oxytocin
In the event of atypical FHS, reduce the oxytocin infusion rate by half or stop oxytocin infusion
In the event of tachysystole with normal atypical fetal monitoring
Decrease oxytocin to half the rate or stop oxytocin infusion
Notify provider if oxytocin rate is decreased
Stop Oxytocin
In the event of an abnormal FHS, stop oxytocin immediately
In the event of tachysystole with an abnormal FHS, stop oxytocin immediately
Apply intrauterine resuscitation interventions defined in (see Intrapartum CPS)
Notify provider if oxytocin is discontinued
Restart Oxytocin
Restart oxytocin at half the rate if it has been discontinued for less than 20 minutes, and the FHR tracing and contraction pattern are normal

Restart oxytocin at initial starting dose if it has been discontinued for 30 min or longer, the FHR tracing and contraction pattern are normal, and a complete fetal and maternal assessment has been discussed with the MRP prior to restarting
For Tachysystole Management
Nitroglycerin 50 micrograms IV every 90 seconds to 3 minutes PRN to a maximum dose of 200 micrograms over 15 min
